fullDescription: Seaholm is a premium watch brand from Austin, TX. While each of these individual notes in the audit below may seem minor, their cumulative effect will increase sales. Itâ€™s not uncommon to see a 10% to 20% lift after a thorough optimization process for a site like this.

points.description: Visitors new to the brand might get confused by the different watches in this navigation. Instead, consider grouping them all under one 'Shop' tab in the navigation. This will let them see all options side by side.
This white text in the navigation is blending with the cloudy background, making it less legible. Consider putting a band of color behind it.
Your logo might hold significance for you, but most visitors probably don't feel the same. Consider scaling it down or removing it.

I think transitioning to premium photography would offer a more elevated representation of your brand than the current video. It would also significantly decrease page load time which will help with SEO.
This headline probably isn't needed. It forces the user to scroll down the page an extra 200px to see the watches.
The visual design of this section could be improved. When center aligned text is more than 15 words long, it becomes difficult to read.
This data about the product's durability is impressive. It could be a key differentiator. Consider adding a section called "Performance" to the main navigation.
These small logos aren't very effective as page breaks. Consider removing them.

These reviews are great but they're hidden in a carousel, where many people might miss them. Research indicates that carousels often see limited interaction, with the majority of users only noticing the first slide. Considering putting the reviews on the product pages where more people will see them.
